basic_info.name: Gyashu Rahman
basic_info.title: Software Engineer | AI-Powered Systems | Scalable Architect

summary.short:
Fullstack Engineer with strong systems background (C++/Rust) and experience deploying production-scale apps using React,
Node.js, and cloud infra. Skilled at bridging web scalability with backend performance and AI-driven features.
summary.medium: Software engineer experienced in React/Node.js, SQL/NoSQL, and cloud deployments, building dashboards and feature-rich apps for 1,000+ users and optimizing performance with measurable results across latency, load times, and retention.
summary.detailed: Engineer with hands-on experience in full-stack development (React, Node.js, Express, MongoDB/MySQL), API design, and Oracle Cloud deployments; delivered client projects and product dashboards with 30%+ performance gains, 1,000+ user scalability, and strong foundations in DSA, DBMS, CN, and OOP; additionally created ML pipelines and simulations for BLDC fault detection with 95%+ accuracy.

experience.description: Built production dashboard and backend services with React, Express, and MySQL, deployed on Oracle Cloud for a learning platform.
achievements: Launched the main dashboard supporting onboarding for 1,000+ users
Reduced API/data latency by ~30% through optimizations and schema design
Led a team of 4 to deliver a hardware client web app, cutting order processing time by 30%
Shipped 5+ client features that increased user retention by ~15%

experience.description: Developed a responsive React/Tailwind website and integrated real-time tour/booking APIs.
achievements: Reduced load time by ~30% using bundling, minification, and lazy loading
Cut data update time by ~50% via realtime API integrations
Improved UX through responsive design and optimized rendering

experience.description: Maintained the society website, added features, and improved responsiveness and performance.
achievements: Implemented new features and regular updates to enhance UX
Collaborated on responsive design and site performance improvements

projects.name: Hybrid Speed Crawler
projects.description: High-throughput (100+ pages/sec) production-grade C++ web crawler engineered for scalability, fault tolerance, and compliance. Features smart frontier scheduling, robots.txt enforcement, HTTP/2 multiplexing, RocksDB persistence, and modular configuration.
achievements: Engineered a high-throughput, policy-compliant web crawler supporting 50–100 pages/sec with hybrid concurrency (work-stealing + partitioned queues + lock-free data structures) and 256-shard domain-aware rate limiting for scalable politeness enforcement.
Implemented an HTTP/2 multiplexed networking layer with connection pooling, conditional GETs, compression, and full TLS verification, achieving low-latency, multi-connection crawling efficiency.
Developed SIMD/AVX2-accelerated HTML parsing, adaptive link extraction, and content filtering pipeline delivering up to 10× throughput improvement in CPU-bound workloads.
Built strict robots.txt compliance and rate-limiting system with dual cache (in-memory + RocksDB), crawl-delay handling, Retry-After backoff, and per-domain policy enforcement.
Persisted metadata, crawl state, and rate-limit tokens in RocksDB with batched I/O and JSON export for analytics and downstream ML/NLP pipelines.
Designed modular, hot-reloadable configuration architecture supporting domain-specific policies, runtime tuning, and pluggable content filters for enrichment integration.
Added robust error handling and fault tolerance mechanisms, including circuit breakers, exponential backoff, domain blacklisting, crash recovery, and graceful shutdown with state persistence.
Integrated Prometheus-based observability and telemetry to expose performance metrics (pages/sec, queue size, error rate) enabling real-time monitoring and alerting.
Delivered a configurable CLI with multiple crawl modes, runtime limits, JSON/CSV exports, compression, and performance logging for flexible large-scale operation.
Packaged and deployed for production via CMake, systemd, Docker, and Kubernetes manifests, supporting single-node and containerized distributed deployments.

projects.name: webpage_quality_analyzer
projects.description: Multi-platform Rust analyzer with a trait-based async runtime, 115 metrics, and a compiled profile-aware scoring engine shipping to Rust, WASM, CLI, and C++.
achievements: Trait-based async runtime abstraction (Tokio vs browser Fetch) with mutually exclusive features for native/WASM; single codebase deploys to 4 targets.
Profile compiler builds Arc<dyn MetricScorer> graph from JSON (8 built-in profiles) with per-metric thresholds, weights, penalties, and bonuses.
DOM cache reduced DOM traversals from 115 to 1, delivering 36–40× speedups and <100ms HTML-only analysis on typical pages.
Batch pipeline reaches 180+ pages/sec via shared connection pooling + semaphore-controlled concurrency.
98.8% output size reduction using field selectors and compact serialization; supports selector-based exports.
WASM production build with fallback content extractor (no blocking I/O), TypeScript bindings, and CI-grade export checks.
C++ staticlib + RAII wrappers and CMake examples; packaged distribution with headers, libs, and examples.
Phase 3–6 scoring features: compiled profiles, per-metric customization, penalties/bonuses, and output filtering.
Fixed cross-cutting scoring correctness: ratio-threshold normalization and custom WordCountScorer with excellence bonuses and clamp propagation.
1000+ downloads across npm and crates.io
projects.impact: Automates content, SEO, accessibility, and technical QA with profile-aware scoring, high-throughput batch analysis, and minimal export footprints across native, browser, and C++.

projects.name: Fault Detection in BLDC Motor
projects.description: ML-based predictive maintenance system using simulation data and feature engineering.
achievements: Achieved 95%+ accuracy with Random Forest and SVM on fault classification
Built end-to-end data pipelines and feature extraction for real-time detection
projects.impact: Demonstrated real-time fault detection feasibility with high accuracy.
